blog.name: boundingintocomics
blog.title: Bounding Into Comics
blog.description: Your Best Source for News, Reviews, and Opinion when it comes to Comics!

title: Avengers: Endgame Runtime Officially Revealed
body:
Avengers: Endgame Runtime Officially Revealed

The Avengers: Endgame runtime has officially been revealed.

Our source sent us an email that revealed The Avengers: Endgame runtime will be 182 minutes. That’s over three hours!

This shouldn’t really be a surprise. In an interview with Collider in February, Joe Russo said the movie would be around the three-hour mark, “We’re still at the three-hour mark.”

Russo would note that Disney was “down”…

View On WordPress

blog.name: millennialfangirl
blog.title: Millennial Fangirl
blog.description: French degree/ Mom/ No Hate/ Occasional writer/ Occasional theorist/ Constant fangirl/ Probably more obsessed with television than I should be/ obsessions: DC/MARVEL TV and Movies, Timeless, Gilmore Girls, Sailor Moon, The Mindy Project, Brooklyn 99, New Girl...the list goes on.

summary: Hi! I ended up renting The Favourite, which I was meh about. I thought it was going to be more of a comedy, but it was kinda sad...
question: Hi! I ended up renting The Favourite, which I was meh about. I thought it was going to be more of a comedy, but it was kinda sad and ultimately a little too weird for me. Then I rewatched Infinity War. After watching it again, I'm even more convinced that Tony will live, have a baby with Pepper, and live a semi-retired life where he pops up to give new Avengers tech, advice and snark, and Steve is gonna sacrifice himself but get a happy afterlife reunion w/Peggy in a surprise cameo. (cont)
answer:
“Also, did you take your daughter to Captain Marvel? I saw it first then took my boys last weekend. It was a little long for them but they enjoyed it. They LOVED Goose and also "when her eyes glowed and she went BOOM.” I made the mistake of telling my 3y/o that Coulson has his own show and has a new, awesome arm, and now that’s who he pretends to be when he plays superhero.“

@missmudpie

I haven’t tried watching The Favourite yet, so good to know.

I CANNOT think about Steve’s sacrifice. It’s so heavy and tragically beautiful. *sigh* In my perfect world, it’s Steve who retires to like a cabin in the woods and paints all day and/or works with vets. Tony is a consultant for the next gen. Thor dies and his powers are passed on to Jane (very unlikely but it happened in the comics). Bruce becomes the hulk permanently as a sacrifice. I’m not sure about Natasha and Hawkeye. Anywho… i’m glad there’s fanfiction 😂😂😂.

I DID take my daughter to see Captain Marvel. She too loved Goose and was mildly impressed by Carol. She liked it, and talked a couple of times about it since, but she’s nowhere near as enamored with superheroes as I am. She’s been obsessed with all things dinosaurs and Jurassic World/Park for a year now. I just wish that universe had a lead female.

You have to let your son watch AoS!!! He has great taste! I loved Coulson’s role in this despite how small it was. It really showed his character well.

I’m hoping to watch all of the movies before Endgame, but that’s unlikely. Did you hear next season will be AoS’s last season? 😢😢😢 But I suppose it should go out on a high note and well planned out ending. The point is, I need to rewatch that too 😂.

blog.name: tonystanktableforone
blog.title: tony stank table for one
blog.description: 18. Desi. Everything Tony Stark. This blog doesn't invite discourse. Also on AO3. Donate/Commission something on my kofi to support me!

body:
random ramblings

okay fr this might just be me

but

so yk the most recent trailer right??

the final few scenes has a voice-over of the og avengers saying “whatever it takes”

and tony’s voice is last

and i just-

everytime i hear it, there’s like this sense of finality that i don’t hear in the others??

like when tony says “whatever it takes,” there’s this kind of edge to it

like he knows

that “whatever it takes” may very well be his life

that might be “whatever it takes”

and im not trying to say that the other characters aren’t aware of this or prepared to sacrifice their lives

but there’s just this tone of desperation and this kind of edge of “this is it. this is how my life ends” that no other voice-over has

and idk if its just rdj’s skill- or the russo brothers asked for him to say it differently

but idk

tony stark saying “whatever it takes” resonates with me differently to every other og avenger saying it

and that

that scares me

summary: Ormai ci siamo, manca veramente poco all’uscita di Avengers: Endgame e tutti noi non vediamo l’ora di scoprire che cosa accadrà...
body:
Ormai ci siamo, manca veramente poco all’uscita di Avengers: Endgame e tutti noi non vediamo l’ora di scoprire che cosa accadrà e come cambierà il Marvel Cinematic Universe. Ora che manca solo un mese, dopo tantissimo tempo di segreti e mistero, inizia a spuntare online non poco materiale pubblicitario per il film, che ci permettono di dare uno sguardo più specifico ai personaggi protagonisti della pellicola.

In particolare la nostra attenzione si concentra su personaggi come Carol Danvers / Capitan Marvel, l’ultima arrivata, e il nostro amatissimo Clint Barton / Occhio di Falco, che in questo film sarà piuttosto diverso rispetto alle versioni precedenti, molto probabilmente a causa dello Schiocco che gli ha portato via la sua famiglia. Nulla di certo, se non che ora il letale Hawkeye veste i panni del micidiale Ronin, come abbiamo intravisto nei trailer, e che abbiamo modo di ammirare meglio grazie a delle action figure della linea Marvel Legends della Hasbro.

Oltre a Ronin abbiamo modo di dare uno sguardo più dettagliato a Capitan America, con indosso la suit bianca, e il Titano Pazzo Thanos.
Qui la galleria con le action figure in questione.

This slideshow requires JavaScript.

Il grave ciclo di eventi messo in atto da Thanos che ha spazzato via metà dell’universo e fratturato i ranghi dei Vendicatori, costringe i rimanenti a prendere una posizione finale nella grande conclusione di ventidue film dei Marvel Studios, Avengers: Endgame.

Avengers: Endgame uscirà nelle sale italiane il 24 aprile 2019, con Anthony e Joe Russo alla regia, su una sceneggiatura di Christopher Markus e Stephen McFeely, basato sui fumetti di Jack Kirby e Jim Starlin e prodotto da Kevin Feige.

Nel cast Robert Downey Jr. (Tony Stark / Iron Man), Chris Evans (Steve Rogers / Capitan America),Chris Hemsworth (Thor), Scarlett Johansson (Natasha Romanoff / Vedova Nera), Jeremy Renner (Clint Barton / Occhio di Falco), Mark Ruffalo (Bruce Banner / Hulk), Brie Larson (Carol Danvers / Capitan Marvel), Karen Gillan (Nebula), Bradley Cooper (Rocket Racoon), Paul Rudd (Scott Lang / Ant-Man), Ty Simpkins (Harley Keener) e Josh Brolin (Thanos).

La fotografia è a cura di Trent Opaloch, mentre la colonna sonora è composta da Alan Silvestri.

Avengers: Endgame, nuovo sguardo a Ronin, Cap e Thanos Ormai ci siamo, manca veramente poco all'uscita di Avengers: Endgame e tutti noi non vediamo l'ora di scoprire che cosa accadrà e come cambierà il

blog.name: fandom-pandom
blog.title: I'm a queer ass nerd y'all
blog.description: I'm pan, I'm nonbinary (they/them), and I like speculative fiction and gay shit. Please excuse the horrific aesthetics of this blog. I don't know how to tumblr right.

summary: Fellow fans, I bring gay tidings
title: Fellow fans, I bring gay tidings
body:
Great news, everybody!

Avengers: Endgame is set in 2019, far after Don’t Ask Don’t Tell has been phased out. If Carol has been visiting Earth in the stretch between Captain Marvel and A:E, she’s legally married to Maria!

If A:E is the first time she’s been on Earth in almost 25 years, she and Maria can finally get married in that film! And if Marvel are too cowardly to make it happen, be prepared for the fluffiest fic you have ever read in your life coming from me.

trail.content:
Great news, everybody!

Avengers: Endgame is set in 2019, far after Don’t Ask Don’t Tell has been phased out. If Carol has been visiting Earth in the stretch between Captain Marvel and A:E, she’s legally married to Maria!

If A:E is the first time she’s been on Earth in almost 25 years, she and Maria can finally get married in that film! And if Marvel are too cowardly to make it happen, be prepared for the fluffiest fic you have ever read in your life coming from me.

summary: i’m not as optimistic now, but i still really want a scene in endgame between thor and wither tony or steve where he’s just...
body:
i’m not as optimistic now, but i still really want a scene in endgame between thor and wither tony or steve where he’s just like

“so, asgard is destroyed. i tried to stop it, but then my dad died and it turns out i have a very evil sister who tried to take over the planet, so we ended up having to trigger ragnarok. before that i was trapped in some firey pit for who knows how long while i was trying to look for infinity stones. what’s up with you guys?”

“um. we fought each other over the signing of a document. anyway, let’s move on.”

like idk it just feels like it could be written as like a peak comedy moment. but yeah.

tags: also i'm still calling it the snap

summary: The Rest of the World After Endgame
title: The Rest of the World After Endgame
body:
I have spent most of my Endgame theorizing energy on the main characters in the MCU. I have also had a few background assumptions about what would happen after everything was resolved that I have remained confident in since shortly after Infinity War. 

My main assumption about the world as a whole is that everything would go back to normal after they reversed the Snap. I have been agnostic about whether the average person would remember the Snap, which I could see going either way, but I have been pretty certain that the majority of the damage would be undone along with the restoration of half the universe’s lifeforms. 

We’ve seen hints about the havoc that Snap has wreaked in the Endgame trailers and the AMATW post-credits scene. Such a drastic event would have to have large-scale consequences, but we haven’t really seen those effects on the general population in other MCU movies, aside from a few small mentions scattered throughout. Because the MCU has not liked to dwell on such things in the past, I assumed that part of the fix would be restore the pre-Snap status quo. 

But I saw a snippet of an interview that one of the writers gave to Empire, talking about how the loss and changes are real. Now, this could be in reference to the main heroes, but it got me thinking that it could also mean that however the Snap is reversed will not undo the large-scale changes that it caused in the world. That could be a super interesting plot thread going forward. 

As with every time I come up with another possibility for how Endgame might turn out, I just want to know what happens. It also always makes feel like I should give up because I always come back to the fact that I really have no idea what they’re going to do. This is only exacerbated by the Russos’ admission that they have used misleading footage in the trailers, which I should expect by now but still get fooled by. But speculating is fun, so I will probably keep doing it until the real end of the line.
